curam.util.client.model

Interface Context

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataAccessorContext, DomainsContext, RendererContext, StylesContext
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractClientResolver

    public interface Context

    A context provides the necessary model information to a control object to permit it to do its work. Depending on the control object, only the minimum amount of context information is exposed. Interfaces derived from this one determine what is exposed. The context interfaces permit implementations to manage the context information in any number of ways and can be used to construct context classes suitable for testing control classes.

    Contexts insulate the infrastructure code from the environment in which it is executing. All information is "injected" via contexts, making the operation of the infrastructure code dependent only on what the contexts provide. Context interfaces can have many different implementations. Just as contexts are implemented to support normal run-time behavior, so they are also implemented to provide test harnesses. As the code into which a context is injected only interacts with the interface methods, execution within a test harness is of equal validity to execution in a normal run-time environment.
